column4: i have installed virtual box-4.0 from the site but when i am clicking it to install it goes to s/w centre and the install option is in frozen mode?
the easiest way to setup 4.0 is modifying your sources.list as described here http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Linux_Downloads

If you want to install the version from virtualbox.org, then follow the instructions here: http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Linux_Downloads where it says "debian-based linux distributions" - it describes how to modify your sources.list
does your cpu have vt-x or vt-d?
i enabled VT,VT-d from BIOS setup
it has vme and vmx also under flags
hmm.. in that case you should be able to run 64bit guest. And your error is..?
i have 64bit as my host also
maybe it requires boot option for the kernel. It's redhat?
yes i want to run red hat under virtual box and Ubuntu is my host OS
you might try asking in #rhel, mentioning your exact error
ok thanx i am going for it.thanx again for giving me time
